item.title: Dashboard Resume
item.description: In the last couple of days, I had a lot of questions about my Data Visualisation skills. So I decided to build a Dashboard Resume and show off some skills :) Check it out: https://iPhuoc.github.io/dashboard/?utm_source=blog It’s not finished yet tho xD

item.title: My Application Video
item.description: I decided to make an application video Check it out (in German): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZGBpcEE9nE

item.title: SBK Case Study
item.description: Last Week I applied at SBK (Siemens Betriebskrankenkasse) as a Data Scientist. After a telehone Interview, I offered them to do a Case Study to prove my skills. Check it out: The presentation https://rpubs.com/iPhuoc/sbk_case_study The Dashboard http://rpubs.com/iPhuoc/sbk_case_study_dashboard

item.title: Adidas Case Study
item.description: UPDATE I had to take everything down Yesss! In November I applied at Adidas as a Data Scientist. After a telephone Interview, they gave me a Case Study. Check it out: My Report https://rpubs.com/iPhuoc/adidas_case The presentation https://rpubs.com/iPhuoc/adidas_case_presentation The Dashboard http://rpubs.com/iPhuoc/adidas_case_study_dashboard and i also currently working on a Webpage https://iphuoc.github.io/adidas-case-study/?utm_source=Phuoc_Blog

item.description: Today I created a shinyapps.io. Let the Application Building begin!!

item.title: Setup RPubs!
item.description: Today I created a RPubs Account, where I can upload all my R Documentations and Presentations!

item.title: My Blog goes Online!
item.description: Finally…. My Webpage and Blog goes online!

item.title: Markdown and Shortcodes
item.description: Thanks! Special thanks to Markdown Cheatsheet. H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 Alt-H1 Alt-H2 # H1 ## H2 ### H3 #### H4 ##### H5 ###### H6 Alt-H1 ====== Alt-H2 ------ Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with asterisks or underscores. Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores. Strikethrough uses two tildes. Scratch this. Emphasis, aka italics, with *asterisks* or _underscores_. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with **asterisks** or __underscores__.

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in go templates. This document is a brief primer on using go templates.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description:
Step 1. Install Hugo

Go to hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your os and architecture.

Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step.

More complete instructions are available at installing hugo

item.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
item.description:
Move static content to static

Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output. Hugo keeps all static content under static. You should therefore move it all there. With Jekyll, something that looked like

▾ <root>/
    ▾ images/
        logo.png
